result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Zamora was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Deft may petition for early discharge when DV class is completed.

miscConds.notes:
Bond from 15CM980 applied.  Balance still due.  
  If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling - Complete DV class, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.   
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Cash bond posted in 15CM980 applied.  Balance still due.    
*  Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.

timeConds.notes: As of 5/26/16 Probation Review Hearing - Conditional jail effective 5/9/16.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney J Allen.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions; deft may petition for early discharge when DV class is completed; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge.

Minutes:  15CM521/15CM980.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty James Allen.  Atty Allen recently appointed.  DA PTC 2/12/16 @ 1:15pm, FPT 3/3/16 @ 8:15am.  Defense filed a bond motion; requests the no contact order be lifted w/complaining witness.  Complaining witness present - also wishes to have contact w/deft.  State objects to any change in the no contact order.  Court will amend the bond - to reflect "no violent contact" between the parties.  In addition, deft shall not be on the premises of complaining witnesses bond.
Atty:  J Allen.

With Atty Rose, and by approval of the court, the FPT of 6/4/15 at 8:45am is rescheduled, as the deft wants time to consider the State's offer and also is getting treatment; reset to 8/5/15 at 8:45am.
